intro: Capnorea lasiantha, commonly known as the desert morning glory, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many vines and flowering plants. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It has a trailing growth habit with small, ovate leaves and is adapted to survive in hot, dry environments. Capnorea lasiantha is often found growing along rocky slopes and in sandy soils.
